98765.name: Disaster losses as % of global GDP (Munich Re)

display.name: Disaster losses as % of global GDP (Munich Re)

98765.datasetName: Economic losses from disasters as a share of GDP (Pielke, 2018)
98765.s_name: Economic losses from disasters as a share of GDP (Pielke, 2018)

source.name: Economic losses from disasters as a share of GDP (Pielke, 2018)
source.dataPublishedBy: Pielke, R. (2018). Tracking progress on the economic costs of disasters under the indicators of the sustainable development goals. Environmental Hazards, 1-6.
source.additionalInfo:
Data represents absolute global economic losses from disasters (total and weather-related) in 2017 US$ from two sources: Munich Re and Aon Benfield. Data from these sources has been cross-checked with data from the EMDAT database (http://www.emdat.be/). The former two sources in general report slightly higher economic losses relative to EMDAT.

This has been normalized to economic losses from disasters as a share of global gross domestic product (GDP) based on global GDP data derived from the World Bank.
